entry.title: Is it possible to preview and print PDF form template of s4hana cloud's In-App CBO using BTP service
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I would like to get the preview and print function of PDF form template for Custom Business Object (that is created in s4hana cloud using In-App/Key User Extensibility).

 

1. Is it possible to add that kind of function by In-App/Key User Extensibility?

If yes, could you please guide me how to do it?

 

2. If In-App/Key User Extensibility is not possible, is it possible with BTP service?

I would like to create Custom Business Object by In-App/Key User Extensibility.

And for preview and print functions, I will use BTP service.

That kind of development, which BTP service should I use and how to develop it?

 

3. If both methods that are mentioned above cannot be worked, could you please guide me how can I develop that kind of requirement?

 

Thank You.

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Unable to Modify Backup Storage & Network Data Transfer Parameters During HANA DB Instance Creation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

While creating a HANA DB instance in our SAP environment, we noticed that the backup storage and network data transfer parameters are being populated automatically. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be any option to modify or deselect these during instance creation.

However, in the SAP Discovery Center Estimator, these parameters can be adjusted, and the cost per capacity unit can vary accordingly.

Could someone please clarify:

  • Why are these parameters fixed during the actual HANA instance creation even though they are configurable in the estimator?
  • Is there any way (or specific service plan/region restriction) that allows modification of these parameters before provisioning?

Would like to validate if this behavior is by design or if there are configuration options we might be missing.

Thanks in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Integration of SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere using JDBC
entry.content:
Integration Between SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere (JDBC Connection)  
 
JDBC ‚Äì JAVA DATABASE CONNECTIVITY 
 
Why Recommendation for JDBC Over OData API : 
JDBC is recommended over OData when consuming large-scale records (e.g., 100,000+) because JDBC streams data directly from the database with better performance and less overhead, while OData is optimized for lightweight, paginated, service-based access. 
 
Problem statement: 3337495 - OData API returns less records than expected due paging 
Pagination limits in OData and Ariba APIs can be handled in SAP CPI using a looping process call. 
 
Goal: Connect CPI to a database used by DataSphere (JDBC) and run a simple read data from the (Analytical Model / Table /View).  
 
For the Write / Delete / Update method, the attached SAP Help Portal Link has syntax in the reference section. 
 
Prerequisites: 

  1. SAP DataSphere ‚Äì Subscribed account (‚ö† Trial has limited features, JDBC not supported) 
  1. SAP Integration Suite ‚Äì Subscribed or Trial (JDBC actions supported) 

 

SAP DataSphere Step by Step Guide : 
 

Step 

Action / Notes 

1. Create a Space 

DataSphere ‚Üí Space Management ‚Üí New Space ‚Üí Name it ‚Üí Create. 

2. Create Table / Analytical Model 

Data Builder ‚Üí In your Space ‚Üí New ‚Üí Table or Analytical Model ‚Üí define fields & data types ‚Üí Save & Publish. 
*Verify Table/Model Deployed Successfully. * 

3. Prepare / Load Data 

Load data manually for testing cases. Otherwise load CSV/import to table via Data Builder/Data Integration. 

4. Note Schema & Object Names 

Record schema name, table name, and view names for JDBC SQL use. 
* Created space name is the SCHEMA name and Collect Table / Model name * 

5. Decide Where to Create DB User 

If HANA Cloud ‚Üí use HANA Cockpit/DB Explorer. If on-prem DB ‚Üí use DB admin tools or contact DB Admin. 
* We are using the HANA cloud system for practical session* 

6. Create JDBC DB User 

DB admin tool ‚Üí Security/Users ‚Üí New User ‚Üí set username & strong password ‚Üí Save. 
*Check Active status of User* 

7. Grant Privileges for the DB user 

Assign only required privileges (e.g., SELECT for read; add INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE for CRUD). Best practice: create role JDBC_ROLE and assign. 

8. Prepare JDBC Connection Details 

Gather JDBC URL (e.g.  sample URL from datasphere: z*********-abc.hana.prod-eu10.hanacloud.ondemand.com 
Format for CPI JDBC Material: 
jdbc:sap://<host>:<port>/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true 

 
SAP Integration Suite Step by Step Guide : 
 
Create a Package & Artifact 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Design ‚Üí Create a new package ‚Üí Add an integration flow artifact. 
  • ‚úÖ Make sure your CPI user has the required roles to create and access design-time artifacts. 
     

Go to Monitoring ‚Üí JDBC Material 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Monitor ‚Üí Integrations and APIs ‚Üí Manage Security ‚Üí JDBC Material

     

     
  • ‚Üí Add JDBC Data Source. ‚Üí Select HANA cloud  

     

     
     
  • Provide JDBC URL in the correct format (e.g., jdbc:sap://<hana-host>:443/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true). 

     

     
  • Enter DB username and password (use the dedicated JDBC user created earlier in DataSphere). 

     

     
  • Save and deploy the JDBC material. 
    •  

    Apply JDBC Material in iFlow

    • In your integration flow, configure the JDBC receiver adapter ‚Üí select the JDBC data source created.
    • Use SQL queries (SELECT) in the Processing tab or provide XML query body. Here, I‚Äôm using SQL SELECT * to fetch all records from the table.

     


    Step 1: Timer Start
     In this iFlow, the Start Timer is configured with a Simple Schedule ‚Üí None ‚Üí On Deployment, which means the integration flow automatically triggers immediately after deployment.

     


    Step 2: Content Modifier
    Use this SQL query to fetch all records with the body operation.
     SELECT * FROM "<Schema>"."<Model/TableName>"

     



    Step 3: Request Reply & JDBC Receiver Adapter
         ‚Üí Use the deployed JDBC Data Source alias in the JDBC Material in the previous step and set Max records count based on your requirement.
    ‚Üí JDBC Maximum Records per call:  2,147,483,647

     


    Sample data Response from JDBC Connection:

     



    References :

    CPI JDBC ‚Äì XML Query in Body for CRUD Operations (Syntax Guide)
     link:
    https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/payload-and-operation

entry.title: What are the ‚Äústandard checks‚Äù executed by the Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products app
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have a question about the Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products app, which was newly introduced in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release.

According to the documentation (see screenshot below), when starting the validation process, the system will ‚Äúcarry out the standard checks.‚Äù

 

However, it‚Äôs not clearly documented what these standard checks actually include ‚Äî for example:

Are these the same validation rules as used in Master Data Governance (MDG). Is there a list or documentation from SAP describing all the standard checks performed by this app?

Should the ‚ÄúManage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products‚Äù app be used during the Hypercare phase? 

I would really appreciate if anyone could share details, or a reference link / note from SAP explaining what these standard checks are.

Thank you in advance for your help!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
App: Manage Remediation Processes ‚Äì Products
Feature area: Master Data Remediation / Product Master

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Configuring Access for Vendor Transactions in S4HANA Public Cloud System
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have four users with specific roles and restrictions:

User A:
- Can post entries for a specific vendor.
- Needs access to all postings and reports related to that vendor.

User B:
- No access to any data related to the vendor managed by User A.

User C:
- Can make payments for all vendors except the one managed by User A.
- Vendor managed by User A should not be visible in any payment applications.

User üòß
- Can make payments only for the vendor managed by User A.

Applications in use include:
- Maintain Business Partner
- Create Supplier Invoice Advance
- Manage Supplier Line Item
- Display Supplier Balance
- Manage Automatic Payment
- Display Journal Entries (with respect to vendor)
- Supplier Down Payment
- Post Outgoing Payment

Could you please suggest ways to configure these settings and meet the requirements?

entry.content:
hello all,

entry.title: How to restrict editing of fields like UOM, weight, and volume in Fiori Manage Product Master Data?
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I have a requirement to restrict editing of certain fields such as Unit of Measure (UOM), weight, and volume in the SAP Fiori Manage Product Master Data tile. These fields should be visible but not editable to users for data consistency and control purposes.

Currently, I am exploring various possibilities including:

  • Using UI adaptation/runtime authoring to make these fields read-only

  • Setting authorization roles and restrictions

  • Extending OData services or adding validations on the backend

Could you please share best practices or known solutions to achieve this? Is there any standard way or recommended approach within SAP S/4HANA and Fiori to restrict these specific fields on the product master data app?
SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database  SAP BTP ABAP environment Security NW ABAP User Administration and Authorization SAP BTP Security field masking for Web Client UI

entry.title: Can we directly access the data stored in SAC when using Import Connection?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,  When we use an  Import Data in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), the imported data gets stored in SAC‚Äôs internal database ? , which I understand is based on SAP HANA Cloud.

My question is ‚Äî since the imported data resides in this internal HANA environment,
is it possible to directly access or query that data (for example, using SAP HANA tools, SQL clients, or external connections)?
Or is this internal storage completely managed and isolated within SAC?

Appreciate any insights or official references on how SAC manages this internal HANA layer and whether external access is technically or administratively possible.

Thanks,
Siva

entry.title: The HANA changes seem to disappear
entry.content: In our CAPM project, both the HANA team and CAPM team are developing artifacts in the same HANA repository. However, whenever we build and deploy the MTA.yaml from the CAPM side, the HANA changes seem to disappear. Why does this happen, and what is the best approach to prevent overwriting or losing HANA artifacts during CAPM deployment?‚Äù

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

Thank you in advance,

entry.title: JPK_KR_PD G/L Account mapping
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm currently having doubts about the way to make the mapping of G/L Accounts with financial tags and income tax tags

1/ According to our system settings, costs or revenues assigned to a single G/L Account can come from both related or unrelated parties (whereas in a standard polish solution, tow different G/L accounts would exist, according to my customer). Therefore, it seems necessary to create tow different entries in the mapping table : "G/L Account + from related entity financial tag" and "G/L Account + from other entity financial tag".

My question is : when creating the report, how will the system differentiate the "from related entities / other entities"  journal entries since they use the same G/L Account. Will the system use the "trading partner"  information to decide which mapping should be applied ? Are there other sscui settings to use for that purpose ?

2/ In the same idea, different tax codes can be assigned to transactions posted on the same G/L Account. So we have to make as many entries in the mapping table as as there are different combinations of G/L account, financial tag, and income tax tag. Is it necessary to make an additional mapping between tax codes that exist in the system and the "official" income tax tags, so that the system correctly assign the mapping to a specific journal entry ?

=> for both questions could it be usefull/necessary to create a Badi to implement dynamic determination of the tags ?

Thank you for your help,

Erwan

entry.title: Unable to create HDI container: Service broker hana-broker failed ‚Äì No database available (Trial sub
entry.content:
I am working on SAP BTP Trial (Cloud Foundry) and trying to create an HDI container for my CAP project.
But whenever I run `cf create-service hana hdi-shared Test_Cap`, I get this error:

Service broker error: Service broker hana-broker failed with:
"Can not create service instance 'Test_Cap': There is no database available.
Ensure that you have a database available in space 'dev' within organization 'a4451e2etrial'."

I already checked the following:

1. SAP HANA Cloud database exists.
2. The database is in RUNNING state.
3. I deleted old HDI containers and retried.
4. I restarted the HANA DB.
5. I recreated space and tried again.
6. I checked with `cf services` and no other HDI instance is blocking.
7. Still getting the same error every time.

It seems the HANA broker is not detecting the running database in my trial account.

My environment:
- Org: a4451e2etrial
- Space: dev
- Plan: hana-cloud (trial)
- Service: hdi-shared
- Command: `cf create-service hana hdi-shared Test_Cap`

Could this be an issue with the trial subaccount or the HANA broker?
Please guide me on how to fix this or whom to contact.

Thanks!

entry.title: 2508 Embedded Steampunk: How can we create Data Provider of form object based on RAP custom app
entry.content:
Hi,

According to the 2508 Embedded Steampunk, there is new feature to create form template in the form object of ABAP Development Tools (ADT) itself.

So, I want to create a form template based on a RAP custom app that is created by Eclipse ADT.

My development steps of RAP custom app are as follow.

1. Database table

2. Data Definition and Projection View

3. Metadata Extension

4. Behavior Definition of both Data Definition and Projection View

5. Service Definition

6. Service Binding with Odata V2 - UI

7. Form Object

 

But after creating custom app, no Data Provider is not available to choose in Form Object.

And, I can‚Äôt continue the development because of this step.

 

So, if you have any idea or any experience about this, could you please share with me how can we continue to proceed?

If you have any helpful documentation or blog posts about it, I‚Äôd appreciate it if you could share them with me.

 

Thank You.

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Deployment Fails Due to Limited Dev Space in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry ‚Äì How to Resolve?
entry.content:
Hi Team!

I am working in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, and my application deployment is failing because the dev space quota is getting exhausted (memory, disk, or service instance limits). The error indicates that the Cloud Foundry space does not have enough available resources to complete the deployment.

Could you please guide me on:

  1. How to check the current resource usage (memory, disk, app instances, service instances) for my Cloud Foundry org/space?

  2. What steps I can take to free up space (e.g., deleting old apps or services, clearing buildpacks, etc.)?

  3. Whether it is possible to request or increase quota for the Cloud Foundry dev space, and how to do that?

  4. Any best practices to avoid running into resource limitations during deployment?

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks!

entry.title: How to Calculate VAT for PO and get in the Standard form(MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER)
entry.content: Hello experts, I‚Äôm using the PO form template MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER. I need to calculate VAT at line item level, sum it up, and show the final amount including VAT in the PO PDF. I understand VAT fields exist in PO item conditions, but they are not exposed in the delivered template. Could you guide me on how to expose these fields via CDS/OData and bind them in the form template, including the calculation logic for summation? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Updating a custom field of std app with a custom app field that is created by dev extensibility
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a custom app that is created by Developer Extensibility in Eclipse.

I also have a custom field in std app of s4hana cloud that is created by using In-App Extensibility.

When new record is created(saved) in custom app,

I would like to update the value of  that custom app field to a custom field of std app.

Is it possible to do so?

If yes, could you please share how we can do it?

 

Thank You. 

Best Regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Can call Custom Business Object deployed from Eclipse CDS view from Customizing Tenant
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We created a custom Business Object (BO) in Eclipse (ABAP project) and deployed it to the Development tenant (080).
However, the BAdI implementation can only be done in the Customizing tenant (100).
In the Customizing tenant, we are unable to call either the CDS view or the outbound service of the custom BO.

Is there any alternative way to access the CDS view or outbound service of the custom BO from the Customizing tenant?
If yes, please share your experience.

entry.title: SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier shows ‚Äúinstance already exists‚Äù but no instance is visible
entry.content:
We are working in a Pay-As-You-Go SAP BTP partner account and initially created a test SAP CAP application connected to an SAP HANA Cloud database. After deleting this setup to start fresh, we encountered an HDI container‚Äìrelated error while creating a new CAP application. When checking the HANA Cloud section, no database instance was visible, but attempts to create a new HANA Cloud instance consistently fail with an error indicating that an instance already exists. We tried deleting and recreating the HANA Cloud service and even removed the entire subaccount, but the same error persists, suggesting a previously provisioned HANA instance is stuck or orphaned and still consuming quota, blocking further database setup.

Error:  BrokerError, Description: You may only create one SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier instance

Main Issue

While setting up a fresh SAP CAP application, I encountered an HDI container error. When checking SAP HANA Cloud, I noticed that no HANA Cloud instance was visible, even though the system behaves as if one already exists.

What I Tried (and Failed)

  • Create a new SAP HANA Cloud instance
    ‚Üí Failed with an error stating that only one instance is allowed (instance already exists)

  • Delete the HANA Cloud database and recreate everything
    ‚Üí Failed (same error persists)

  • Delete the entire SAP BTP subaccount and recreate everything
    ‚Üí Failed (same error still occurs)

Current Situation

It appears that an existing or orphaned HANA Cloud instance is still consuming quota, even though it is not visible or accessible, which is blocking further database setup and CAP development.

 

I would appreciate any guidance on how to clean up or reset this stuck SAP HANA Cloud instance so that we can proceed with database setup and continue CAP development.

entry.title: How to Net the invoice amount by Business Partner?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Expert,

I would like to know the way to net the invoice from the business partner.

I have 1 business partner, and the business partner has a supplier role and a customer role.

Sample

BP Code 100001 >> Supplier Invoice -1000 USD, Customer Invoice 1500 USD 

I would like to net the invoice amounts of -1,000 USD and 1,500 USD, resulting in a net balance of 500 USD on the customer side, and then post the incoming payment for the receivable amount.

Please advise.

Thanks,

May
